awd_titl_txt: 1992 Gordon Research Conference on High Temperature         Chemistry, Kingston, R.I., July 20-24, 1992
awd_abstract_narration: Financial support is requested to bring three to four young                scientists from Eastern Europe ($4,800) and a selected number of                ($1,700) to the GRC scheduled for July 20-24, 1992.  The chief aim              is to identify future scientific leaders in high-temperature                    chemistry and provide a medium for their interaction with approxi-              mately 125 scientists from academic, industrial, and government                 laboratories.  Participants will discuss fundamental thermodynamic              properties of refractory materials, stability and structure of                  molecules at high temperature, theory of the relation of structure              to the properties, etc.  These topics are important in material                 design and processing, energy conversions, and microelectronics.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
